results.title: Correction of arterial structure and endothelial dysfunction in human essential hypertension by the angiotensin receptor antagonist losartan.
results.text_hl: Because angiotensin II may be pivotal in some of these @DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@vascular abnormalities@@@, we tested the hypothesis that the angiotensin type 1 (AT(1)) receptor antagonist @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@, in contrast to the beta-blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, would correct @<m>DISEASE_Disease_Resistance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060467 @@@resistance artery abnormalities@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Essential_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000075222 @@@essential hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Schiffrin EL, Park JB, Intengan HD, Touyz RM. Correction of arterial structure and endothelial dysfunction in human essential hypertension by the angiotensin receptor antagonist losartan. Circulation. 2000 Apr 11;101(14):1653-9. PMID: 10758046
citations.BibTeX: @article{10758046, title={Correction of arterial structure and endothelial dysfunction in human essential hypertension by the angiotensin receptor antagonist losartan.}, author={Schiffrin EL and Park JB and Intengan HD and Touyz RM}, journal={Circulation}, volume={101}, number={14}, pages={1653-9}}

results.title: Comparison of the effects of atenolol and nifedipine on glucose, insulin, and lipid metabolism in patients with hypertension.
results.text_hl: The changes in day-long plasma @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ and @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ responses suggested that @<m>DISEASE_Disease_Resistance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060467 @@@resistance@@@ to @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@-stimulated @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ uptake had increased in association with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment and decreased following @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Sheu WH, Swislocki AL, Hoffman B, Chen YD, Reaven GM. Comparison of the effects of atenolol and nifedipine on glucose, insulin, and lipid metabolism in patients with hypertension. Am J Hypertens. 1991 Mar;4(3 Pt 1):199-205. PMID: 2043298
citations.BibTeX: @article{2043298, title={Comparison of the effects of atenolol and nifedipine on glucose, insulin, and lipid metabolism in patients with hypertension.}, author={Sheu WH and Swislocki AL and Hoffman B and Chen YD and Reaven GM}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={4}, number={3 Pt 1}, pages={199-205}}
